noun.description: More fully "ahuehuete tree". A Mexican cypress, Taxodium mucronatum (family Cupressaceae), which can attain great girth, commonly grown as an ornamental and also important for the production of timber and (especially formerly) medicinal resins.

origin: Late 18th century. In some forms from (i) French ahuehuete and its etymon (ii) Mexican Spanish ahuehuete from Nahuatl āhuēhuētl.
